digest verb
(EAT)
C1 [ I or T ] to change food in your stomach into substances that your body can use: I find that I don't digest meat easily. Sit still and allow your meal to digest.
More examplesFewer examplesThe adult owls feed their young with food which they've already partly digested.Don't rush off - let's just sit here a while and digest our food.How can you expect to digest your food properly when you eat your meals so fast?The snake lay absolutely motionless for hours as it digested its meal.Meat-eaters must produce extensive bile acids in their intestines to properly digest the meat that they eat.

digest verb
(UNDERSTAND)
C1 [ T ] to read or hear new information and take the necessary time to understand it: This chapter is so difficult to digest, I'll have to read it again later.
